Request Functions

  • request_agent - Get request agent capabilities

  • request_body - Get data from request body

  • request_cookie - Get data from HTTP cookie

  • request_file - Get file from request

  • request_files - Get files from request

  • request_header - Get data from request header

  • request_host - Get requester host name

  • request_id - Get request ID

  • request_ip - Get requester ip address

  • request_param - Get parameter from requested URI

  • request_segment - Get segment from requested URI

Many of the request functions below are just aliases for the methods of the PHPCore Request Class.

See also

PHPCore Request Class The PHPCore request class.

request_agent(?string $key = null)

Get request agent capabilities

Attempts to determine the capabilities of the user’s browser, by looking up the browser’s information in the browscap.ini file. Then returns the capability by the given $key.

If $key is not passed the entire capabilities object will be returned.

Returns NULL if get_browser() fails or requested capability is unknown.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – The key of the capability data item to retrieve

Returns

mixed The request capability or the entire capability object

Example 37 Get request agent capabilities
 1<?php
 2// $_SERVER['HTTP_USER_AGENT'] = 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/109.0.0.0 Safari/537.36'
 3
 4// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 5// Get by key
 6echo request_agent('browser'); // 'Chrome'
 7var_dump(request_agent('istablet')); // false
 8
 9// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
10// Direct chain
11echo request_agent()->device_type; // 'Desktop'
12
13?>

request_body(?string $key = null, ?int $filter = null, array|int $options = 0)

Get data from request body

Will parsed the request body based on the format, then return data from the parsed body by a given $key for data passed via the HTTP POST method. The option $filter and $options parameters may be given to invoke filter_var() before the value is returned.

If $key is not passed the request body be returned and the $filter and $options will be ignored.

See also

PHP Types of filters - List of available filters and options. PHP Filter Variable - Information on the operation of the filter_var() function.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – The key of the body’s data to retrieve

  • $filter (integer) – The ID of the filter to apply

  • $options (array|int) – Associative array of options or bitwise disjunction of flags

Returns

mixed The requested data item

Example 38 Get data from request body
 1<?php
 2// $_POST = '{ "name": "Smith", "age": "22" }'
 3
 4// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 5// Get by key
 6echo request_body('name'); // 'Smith'
 7var_dump(request_body('name', FILTER_VALIDATE_INT)); // 22
 8
 9// ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
10// Direct chain
11echo request_body()->age; // '22'
12
13?>

Back to list

request_cookie(string $key, ?int $filter = null, array|int $options = 0)

Get data from HTTP cookie

Will return data from cookie by a given $key for data passed via HTTP Cookies. The option $filter and $options parameters may be given to invoke filter_var() before the value is returned.

See also

PHP Types of filters - List of available filters and options. PHP Filter Variable - Information on the operation of the filter_var() function.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – The key of the cookie to retrieve

  • $filter (integer) – The ID of the filter to apply

  • $options (array|int) – Associative array of options or bitwise disjunction of flags

Returns

mixed The requested data item

Example 39 Get data from HTTP cookie
1<?php
2// $_COOKIE = [ 'OFFSET' => 1, 'ORDER' => 'asc' ]
3
4echo request_cookie('ORDER'); // 'asc'
5var_dump(request_cookie('OFFSET', FILTER_VALIDATE_INT)); // 1
6
7?>

request_file(string $key)

Get file from request

Will return the file by a given $key for the files that was uploaded via the HTTP POST method using the $_FILES superglobal variable.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – The key of the file to retrieve

Returns

object|null RequestFile object

Example 40 Get file from request
 1<?php
 2// $_FILES['test'] = [
 3//     'name'      => 'sample.pdf.png',
 4//     'full_path' => 'sample.pdf.png',
 5//     'type'      => 'image/png',
 6//     'tmp_name'  => '/tmp/php059gDH',
 7//     'error'     => 0,
 8//     'size'      => 3028
 9// ];
10
11echo request_file('test')->name; // 'image/png'
12echo request_file('test')->trueType(); // 'application/pdf'
13
14?>

Back to list

request_files(string $key)

Get files from request

Will return an array of files for a given $key that were uploaded via the HTTP POST method using the $_FILES superglobal variable.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – The key of the array of files to retrieve

Returns

array Array of RequestFile objects

Example 41 Get files from request
 1<?php
 2// $_FILES['test'] = [
 3//     'name'      => [ 0 => 'sample.pdf.png' ],
 4//     'full_path' => [ 0 => 'sample.pdf.png' ],
 5//     'type'      => [ 0 => 'image/png'      ],
 6//     'tmp_name'  => [ 0 => '/tmp/php059gDH' ],
 7//     'error'     => [ 0 => 0                ],
 8//     'size'      => [ 0 => 3028             ]
 9// ];
10
11echo request_files('test')[0]->name; // 'image/png'
12echo request_files('test')[0]->trueType(); // 'application/pdf'
13
14?>

Back to list

request_header(string $key, ?int $filter = null, array|int $options = 0)

Get data from request header

Will return data from the HTTP request headers for a given $key. The option $filter and $options parameters may be given to invoke filter_var() before the value is returned.

The key will be searched for both without then with the prefix “x-” to be compatiable with older conventions. Therfore there is no need include the prefix “x-” in your code moving forward.

See also

PHP Types of filters - List of available filters and options. PHP Filter Variable - Information on the operation of the filter_var() function.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – The key of the header’s data to retrieve

  • $filter (integer) – The ID of the filter to apply

  • $options (array|int) – Associative array of options or bitwise disjunction of flags

Returns

mixed The requested header item

Example 42 Get data from request header
 1<?php
 2// Request Headers
 3//   Accept: */*
 4//   Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
 5//   Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.9
 6//   Connection: keep-alive
 7//   Content-Length: 0
 8//   User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/111.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
 9//   x-custom-header-1: Random Text
10//   x-custom-header-2: 12345
11
12echo request_header('accept-encoding'); // 'gzip, deflate'
13echo request_header('custom-header-1'); // 'Random Text'
14echo request_header('x-custom-header-1'); // 'Random Text'
15
16var_dump(request_header('custom-header-2', FILTER_VALIDATE_INT)); // 12345
17
18?>

Back to list

request_host()

Get requester host name

This method will return the requester’s host name using the requester’s ip address, see Request::ip() for more information.

Returns false if requester ip address is unknown.

Returns

string|false Host name

Example 43 Get requester host name
1<?php
2
3// $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] = '8.8.8.8'
4echo request_host(); // 'dns.google'
5
6// $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] = '123456'
7var_dump(request_host()); // false
8
9?>

Back to list

request_id()

Get request ID

Gets the unique identifier based on the REQUEST_TIME_FLOAT, Request::ip() and the REQUEST_URI.

Returns

string Request ID

Example 44 Get request ID
1<?php
2// $_SERVER['REQUEST_TIME_FLOAT'] = 1681363597.2922
3// $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] = '10.0.0.101'
4// $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'] = '/test.php'
5
6echo request_id(); // '9e86384b69d5abe885fe33baff74bf37'
7
8?>

Back to list

request_ip()

Get requester ip address

This method will return the requester’s ip address via the designated $_SERVER param that contains the requester’s IP Address. This is normally REMOTE_ADDR or HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR and can be configured in the phpcore.ini file.

Returns false if $_SERVER param is not set.

Returns

string|false IP Address of requester

Example 45 Get requester ip address
 1<?php
 2// $_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'] = '10.0.0.1'
 3// $_SERVER['HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR'] = '192.168.0.1'
 4
 5// phpcore.ini: request.ip_var = "REMOTE_ADDR"
 6echo request_ip(); // '10.0.0.1'
 7
 8// phpcore.ini: request.ip_var = "HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR"
 9echo request_ip(); // '192.168.0.1'
10
11?>

Back to list

request_param(?string $key = null, ?int $filter = null, array|int $options = 0)

Get parameter from requested URI

This method will return the variable passed to the current script via the URL parameters (aka. query string) by a given $key using $_GET superglobal varable. If the key is not passed then an array of all the variables will be returned.

If $key is not passed the entire query be returned and the $filter and $options will be ignored.

See also

PHP Types of filters - List of available filters and options. PHP Filter Variable - Information on the operation of the filter_var() function.

Parameters

  • $key (string) – The key of the query to retrieve

  • $filter (integer) – The ID of the filter to apply

  • $options (array|int) – Associative array of options or bitwise disjunction of flags

Return mixedmixed

The requested query item

Example 46 Get parameter from requested URI
1<?php
2// $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'] = '/index.php?text=abc&num=12345'
3
4var_dump(Request::param()); // [ "text" => "abc", "num" => "12345" ]
5
6var_dump(Request::param('text')); // 'abc'
7var_dump(Request::param('num', FILTER_VALIDATE_INT)); // 12345
8
9?>

Back to list

request_segment(?int $pos = null, ?int $filter = null, array|int $options = 0)

Get segment from requested URI

This method will return a segment of the requested URI with a given $pos using the REQUEST_URI.

If $pos is not passed the entire segment array will be returned and the $filter and $options will be ignored.

See also

PHP Types of filters - List of available filters and options. PHP Filter Variable - Information on the operation of the filter_var() function.

Parameters

  • $pos (integer) – The pos index of the path to retrieve

  • $filter (integer) – The ID of the filter to apply

  • $options (array|int) – Associative array of options or bitwise disjunction of flags

Return mixedmixed

The requested segment item

Example 47 Get segment from requested URI
 1<?php
 2use \PHPCore\Request;
 3// $_SERVER['REQUEST_URI'] = '/sections/articles/12345.html'
 4
 5var_dump(Request::segment()); // [ "sections", "articles", "12345" ]
 6
 7var_dump(Request::segment(1)); // 'articles'
 8var_dump(Request::segment(2, FILTER_VALIDATE_INT)); // 12345
 9
10// phpcore.ini: request.segment_offset = 1
11var_dump(Request::segment(0)); // 'articles'
12
13?>
